update_every.title: Update every
update_every.description: How often to collect metrics from the database, in seconds.

autodetection_retry.title: Detection retry
autodetection_retry.description: How often Netdata retries failed automatic detection jobs, in seconds. Set to 0 to disable retries.

driver.title: Driver
driver.description: SQL driver / database engine to use. Supported values: `mysql` (MySQL/MariaDB), `pgx` (PostgreSQL), `oracle`.

dsn.title: DSN
dsn.description: Database connection string (DSN). The format depends on the selected driver.

timeout.title: Timeout
timeout.description: Maximum time allowed for a single query and connection check, in seconds.

static_labels.title: Static labels
static_labels.description: Key/value labels automatically added to every chart created by this job (for example `env=prod`, `region=eu-west`).

queries.title: Reusable queries
queries.description: Optional list of reusable SQL queries that metric blocks can reference via `query_ref` to avoid repeating SQL text.

id.title: ID
id.description: Unique query identifier referenced from metric blocks using `query_ref` within this job.

query.title: Query
query.description: SQL statement text executed when this query is referenced.

metrics.title: Metric blocks
metrics.description: List of metric blocks. Each block runs one query and maps its result set into one or more Netdata charts.

id.title: ID
id.description: Metric block identifier. Must be unique within this job.

query_ref.title: Query ref
query_ref.description: Reference to a reusable query defined in `queries`. Exactly one of `query_ref` or `query` must be set.

query.title: Inline query
query.description: Inline SQL statement for this metric block. Exactly one of `query_ref` or `query` must be set.

mode.title: Mode
mode.description: How to interpret the result rows. `columns` treats selected columns as metrics. `kv` treats one column as metric name (key) and another as its value.

labels_from_row.title: Labels from row
labels_from_row.description: Optional labels derived from result columns. Each unique combination of label values produces a separate chart instance.

source.title: Source column
source.description: Name of the result column whose value will be used as the label value.

name.title: Label key
name.description: Label key/name added to the chart (for example `db`, `schema`, `table`).

charts.title: Charts
charts.description: One or more Netdata charts generated from this metric block.

title.title: Title
title.description: Human-friendly chart title shown in Netdata dashboards.

context.title: Context
context.description: Base metric context name for the chart. The collector will prefix it as `sql.<driver>_<context>` to form the full Netdata context. Contexts define the metric namespace, control alert templates, and group charts across jobs and nodes.

family.title: Family
family.description: Chart family used to organize charts in the Netdata UI. You can use '/' to create hierarchical grouping levels (e.g. `Database/Connections/Active`). Each level becomes a nested section in the dashboard.

units.title: Units
units.description: Unit label for all dimensions in this chart (for example `queries/s`, `bytes`, `connections`).

algorithm.title: Algorithm
algorithm.description: How Netdata interprets values: `absolute` for values that are already final, `incremental` for monotonically increasing counters.

dims.title: Dimensions
dims.description: Definitions of the metrics (dimensions) that belong to this chart.

name.title: Name
name.description: Dimension identifier, unique within this chart. Also used as the legend name.

source.title: Source
source.description: In `columns` mode: the numeric result column to read. In `kv` mode: the key name that must match a value in `kv_mode.name_col`.

status_when.title: Status when
status_when.description: Optional condition that turns this dimension into a boolean 0/1 status metric. The dimension is 1 if any row matches the condition, otherwise 0.

equals.title: Equals
equals.description: Use 1 when the value is exactly equal to this literal, otherwise 0. Only one of `equals`, `in`, or `match` may be set.

in.title: In
in.description: Use 1 when the value is equal to any element in this list, otherwise 0. Only one of `equals`, `in`, or `match` may be set.

match.title: Match (regex)
match.description: Use 1 when the value matches this regular expression, otherwise 0. Only one of `equals`, `in`, or `match` may be set.

kv_mode.title: KV mode
kv_mode.description: Configuration for `kv` mode that tells the collector which columns hold the key and value.

name_col.title: Name column
name_col.description: Name of the result column that contains metric keys (for example `state`).

value_col.title: Value column
value_col.description: Name of the result column that contains numeric metric values for each key.

vnode.title: Vnode
vnode.description: Name of the Virtual Node this job should send its metrics to. Leave empty to use the local node.

vnode.ui:placeholder: To use this option, first create a Virtual Node and then reference its name here.

autodetection_retry.ui:help: This option determines how frequently (in seconds) Netdata will retry data collection jobs that failed initially; setting it to 0 disables this retry mechanism entirely.

dsn.ui:help:
**DSN format depends on the selected driver.**

### MySQL / MariaDB
Format: `user:password@tcp(host:port)/dbname?param1=value1&paramN=valueN`
Example:
```
root:pass@tcp(127.0.0.1:3306)/
```
[MySQL DSN documentation](https://github.com/go-sql-driver/mysql#dsn-data-source-name)

### PostgreSQL
Formats: `postgresql://user:password@host:5432/dbname?param1=value1&paramN=valueN`
Example:
```
postgresql://user:pass@localhost:5432/mydb
```
[PostgreSQL DSN documentation](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/libpq-connect.html#LIBPQ-CONNSTRING-URIS)

### Oracle
Format: `oracle://username:password@host:port/service?param1=value1&paramN=valueN`
Example:
```
oracle://scott:tiger@db.example.com:1521/ORCLPDB1?ssl=off
```

static_labels.ui:help: Optional key/value labels added to every chart created by this job (for example env=prod, role=primary).
